1.text: Be ye therefore imitators of God, as beloved children;

2.text: and walk in love, even as Christ also loved you, and gave himself up for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God for an odour of a sweet smell.

3.text: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not even be named among you, as becometh saints;

4.text: nor filthiness, nor foolish talking, or jesting, which are not befitting: but rather giving of thanks.

5.text: For this ye know of a surety, that no fornicator, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, which is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God.

6.text: Let no man deceive you with empty words: for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the sons of disobedience.

7.text: Be not ye therefore partakers with them;

8.text: For ye were once darkness, but are now light in the Lord: walk as children of light

9.text: (for the fruit of the light is in all goodness and righteousness and truth),

10.text: proving what is well-pleasing unto the Lord;

11.text: and have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather even reprove them;

12.text: for the things which are done by them in secret it is a shame even to speak of.

13.text: But all things when they are reproved are made manifest by the light: for everything that is made manifest is light.

14.text: Wherefore he saith, Awake, thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall shine upon thee.

15.text: Look therefore carefully how ye walk, not as unwise, but as wise;

16.text: redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

17.text: Wherefore be ye not foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.

18.text: And be not drunken with wine, wherein is riot, but be filled with the Spirit;

19.text: speaking one to another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody with your heart to the Lord;

20.text: giving thanks always for all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God, even the Father;

21.text: subjecting yourselves one to another in the fear of Christ.

22.text: Wives, be in subjection unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.

23.text: For the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ also is the head of the church, being himself the saviour of the body.

24.text: But as the church is subject to Christ, so let the wives also be to their husbands in everything.

25.text: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself up for it;

26.text: that he might sanctify it, having cleansed it by the washing of water with the word,

27.text: that he might present the church to himself a glorious church, not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

28.text: Even so ought husbands also to love their own wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his own wife loveth himself:

29.text: for no man ever hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as Christ also the church;

30.text: because we are members of his body.

31.text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife; and the twain shall become one flesh.

32.text: This mystery is great: but I speak in regard of Christ and of the church.

33.text: Nevertheless do ye also severally love each one his own wife even as himself; and let the wife see that she fear her husband.
